com.daohoangson.uml.gui
Class Diagram

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  com.daohoangson.uml.gui.Diagram
All Implemented Interfaces:
StructureListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class Diagram
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements StructureListener

Diagram Manager and Swing-based Component. It holds structures and display them itself. Organize structures in tree. Supports relationships. Supports saving image also.

Version:
1.3
Author:
Dao Hoang Son
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

getScrollable

public java.awt.Component getScrollable()
Get the scrollable component. Use this for a better user experience. Anyway, this is optional. You can always Container.add(Component) directly this object.

Returns:
a JScrollPane object of the diagram

public Structure[] getStructures()
Gets all structures in the diagram.

Returns:
array containing structures in the diagram

saveImage

public void saveImage(java.awt.image.ImageObserver observer)
Generate an image of the diagram to the specified path. Only support JPG and PNG format. Use the correct extension in the path to select image format.
The trick here is done by calling drawing methods targeting the Graphics instance of the image but not of the diagram. Call Component.repaint() and let them do the drawing part and then call it again to make sure the on-screen visualization is correct.
The image quality is not perfect. There is some missing lines, I have no idea :(

Parameters:
observer - the observer which get notified when image is built
See Also:
#paint(Graphics)}
